result.execSummary:
The defendant David Silva Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

No violent  behavior with anyone.

Participate and cooperate in Alcohol and Drug assessment.  Successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Pay court costs, fees, assessments, and surcharges, including DNA if applicable by 12-10-16 or civil judgment to be entered. Cash bail applied.

records.addlTxt: Defendant David Silva in court with attorney Awni M Yasin.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense requesting this case be transferred to Branch 18 (Colon) for a resolution of this case. Defendant has a pending felony (16CF2497) plea and sentencing before Branch 18. No objection from the State. Court will allow for the transfer only if Branch 18 is willing to accept this case.  Sentencing Hearing on Revocation scheduled for September 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Certification of PLEA & SENTENCING transcript commencing 12-10-2015 received and filed. (29 Pages.) CH
Copy of transcript forwarded to:  SENTENCING AFTER REVOCATION FOR THE COURT.

Attorney Awni Yasin contacted the Court to schedule sentencing after revocation hearing. Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing after revocation hearing in Branch 45 on August 15, 2016 at 1:30 p.m.   All parties are advised effective August 1, 2016 this case is assigned to the Honorable Jean Kies, Branch 45 in Room 615 of the Courthouse.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
Awaiting response from Public defender appointed attorney to schedule sentencing after revocation hearing.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Pursuant to current District Court Rules, this case is assigned and 
forwarded to Judge Rifelj
for review. os

( X ) SENTENCE AFTER REVOCATION

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 2:

Court ordered sentence WITHHELD with credit for 7 (seven) days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 1 year:


CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
 
      *  As a condition of probation, the Court ordered
          the defendant to serve 30 days (STRAIGHT TIME)
          in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed 
          to be used at agent's discretion. 
      * No contact with victim Teresa S.
      * No violent behaivor with anyone.
      * Defendant to participate and cooperate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
          and successfully complete recommended treatment
          including random urine screens.
      *  If recommended: Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed
          medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.    
      *  Participate and complete Restore to Justice Program.
      *  Court waived non-mandatory costs.
          Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges by June 10, 2016. 
          Any remaining balance will be due immediately or an entry 
          of a civil judgment shall be imposed.
 .
Appeal rights given,
     
Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Rights and Pretrial Incarceration Credit; received and filed.

Defendant David Silva in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

AS TO COUNT 1:

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 2:

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.
